intro: Ardisia sapida, commonly known as the red beauty or Indian ink tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, followed by dark red, glossy berries.
